summary: This FBI document details an investigation into Alfredo Rodriguez, a former employee of Jeffrey Epstein, who attempted to sell documents related to a civil case against Epstein to attorney Bradley Edwards for $50,000. The FBI authorized a consensual call with an undercover employee to facilitate the transaction, indicating potential obstruction of justice.

persons.name: Bradley James Edwards
persons.role: Attorney representing plaintiffs in civil case against Jeffrey Epstein
persons.context: Attorney who was contacted by Alfredo Rodriguez and was deposing him. He reported Rodriguez's attempt to sell documents to the FBI and agreed to participate in a consensual call with an undercover agent.

persons.name: Alfredo Rodriguez
persons.context: Former Epstein employee who was deposed by Bradley Edwards and served with a federal subpoena. He attempted to sell documents related to the Epstein civil case to Edwards for $50,000, leading to an FBI investigation for obstruction of justice.

persons.name: Jeffrey Epstein
persons.context: The individual being sued in the civil case for which the documents were sought. His former employee, Alfredo Rodriguez, possessed documents related to this case.

connections.description: Rodriguez was an employee for Epstein, as stated in the document.
Edwards, as an attorney for plaintiffs suing Epstein, deposed Rodriguez and served him with a federal subpoena. Rodriguez then attempted to sell documents to Edwards.
Edwards is an attorney representing four female individuals who are suing Jeffrey Epstein.

events.title: Rodriguez contacts Edwards to sell documents
events.description: On or about August 2009, Alfredo Rodriguez contacted attorney Bradley Edwards and attempted to sell him documents pertinent to the civil case against Jeffrey Epstein for $50,000.

events.title: FBI authorizes consensual monitoring
events.description: The FBI authorized a consensual call where Edwards would introduce an Undercover Employee (UCE) to Alfredo Rodriguez to complete the document transaction, as part of an obstruction of justice investigation.

keyFacts: Alfredo Rodriguez, a former employee of Jeffrey Epstein, attempted to sell documents related to the Epstein civil case to plaintiff's attorney Bradley Edwards for $50,000.
Bradley Edwards had already deposed Rodriguez and served him with a federal subpoena to provide the documents, making Rodriguez's attempt to sell them potentially illegal.
The FBI authorized a consensual monitoring operation involving an undercover employee to facilitate the transaction as part of an obstruction of justice investigation.
The document indicates the investigation was initiated following a request from a 'high ranking doj official'.
The case ID is 72-MM-113327, and the investigation involves potential violations of U.S. Code Title 18, Sections 1509 and 1510 (obstruction of justice).
